channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Search teams at the site of a China Eastern Airlines crash have found the second black box https://t.co/olC6Oh10oN

Close to the fight to seize Kyiv, doctors at Hospital #8 are adjusting and improvising to treat the injured. “Of course we are not what we used to be, but neither is the rest of the country.” https://t.co/4CKy7NOKbQ

Years of tensions between Hungary and Ukraine burst into public view, when Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky castigated Hungarian leader Viktor Orban via video link as he spoke to a meeting of EU leaders. https://t.co/SRGcPrNmhy
Beijing is wary that its alignment with Russia during the Ukraine crisis could also cost its relationship with Europe https://t.co/GImpIWs1AZ

The palatial and ornate Manhattan mansions depicted on the hit HBO series "The Gilded Age" once existed, but have almost all been demolished. Take a closer look at the vanished mansions of Gilded Age New York, and some of the rare structures that remain. https://t.co/16aqlEIYlN
In his final season, Duke coach Mike Krzyzewski is back in the Final Four for the 13th time after an Elite Eight win over Arkansas https://t.co/eva5MRRZ8i
Obituary: John V. Roach, a down-home Texan who helped bring personal computers into American homes, has died https://t.co/VbcqQlunyw
The Ukrainian dumplings known as varenyky are similar to Japanese gyoza and Turkish manti, a reminder that the world’s food traditions have a lot in common. https://t.co/9gHemFSZsK

From @WSJopinion: Media and tech companies that colluded in concealing potentially critical information about Hunter Biden in 2020 will pay no price. This is what is so corrosive of trust and, in the end, of the system itself, writes @gerardtbaker. https://t.co/BVFSzOnB8p
Biden will propose a new minimum tax on households worth more than $100 million as part of his annual budget, the White House said https://t.co/CXjL56EB1V
Russia said it was refocusing its mission in Ukraine on the country’s east, indicating a shift from its initial attempt to capture Kyiv https://t.co/X18kSKOthS

Russian missiles struck a site near Lviv. The city is just 40 miles east of the Polish border. The attack occurred as President Biden was visiting the Polish capital Warsaw roughly 210 miles away. https://t.co/CBDp7OI4sW
Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu said Russia would replenish its stock of weapons and invest to ensure the country’s nuclear forces would remain combat ready. https://t.co/DNGBijBvrm
A New Zealand couple hoped the 17-pound tuber they found in their garden would break the Guinness Record for a giant potato. DNA testing showed it wasn’t even a potato. https://t.co/zcLp2TTDAS
Smaller harvests loom from Argentina to Indonesia as the Russia-Ukraine war cuts global fertilizer supplies. “It’s like a scary movie,” a farmer says. https://t.co/NbR9ebOHL4
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/QT8ZOg5YM8 https://t.co/de0Cekjg0k
From @WSJopinion: Neither the Saudis nor the Emiratis will take Biden’s calls. The U.S. needs to recommit to the region, writes @FirasMaksad. https://t.co/s9tz4T06ro
Scientific groups and researchers studying climate change in the Arctic are pausing collaborations with Russian counterparts over the war in Ukraine https://t.co/n57Hsz0IWt
Essay: Cardiovascular disease is America’s deadliest pandemic but also its most preventable, writes former CDC director Tom Frieden https://t.co/QXAq2Hca80

Close to the fight to seize Kyiv, doctors at Hospital #8 are adjusting and improvising to treat the injured. “Of course we are not what we used to be, but neither is the rest of the country.” https://t.co/2HaMgYAOc9
Essay: “Just war” theory helps explain why the Ukrainians, and the world, should oppose Russian aggression, writes philosopher Michael Walzer https://t.co/hHAxBebIxm

Thousands of Ukrainians and Russians fleeing war and sanctions are increasingly using Mexico as a transit point as they try to migrate to the U.S. Most choose this route because they don’t need a visa to fly directly to Mexico. https://t.co/ZD8FOGFSbh
Russia’s shifting war plan highlights how the Kremlin’s broader effort to take over most or all of Ukraine has stalled https://t.co/JQyON1mZMy

Bananas and flowers that can’t get to Russia due to sanctions against Moscow and logjams at European ports are piling up as the war in Ukraine wreaks havoc on some small countries https://t.co/q5GYkmjbW6

Sen. Joe Manchin said he will support the nomination of Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson for the Supreme Court, a significant step toward her confirmation by the evenly divided Senate https://t.co/4aTnd2PF7N

Thousands of Ukrainians and Russians fleeing war and sanctions are increasingly using Mexico as a transit point as they try to migrate to the U.S. Most choose this route because they don’t need a visa to fly directly to Mexico. https://t.co/C6KKAWDxZm

Bananas and flowers that can’t get to Russia due to sanctions against Moscow and logjams at European ports are piling up as the war in Ukraine wreaks havoc on some small countries https://t.co/w2jV1c2zLZ
Pope Francis celebrated a liturgy for peace between Russia and Ukraine, lamenting the “vicious war,” while maintaining his neutrality https://t.co/sniVURRo2F
Vanessa Bryant, widow of the late basketball star Kobe Bryant, and Nike have reached an agreement to collaborate on new shoes and start a youth basketball center https://t.co/7vw2TveEHy
Beijing is wary that its alignment with Russia during the Ukraine crisis could also cost its relationship with Europe https://t.co/lrJmgnwsKU

Michelle Pfeiffer, Tyra Banks, Jennifer Aniston: They’ve all shared selfies with seemingly zero makeup on, faces bare of Instagram’s typical high gloss. What are they really trying to say? https://t.co/hsP2ZPi00j
The U.S. will welcome up to 100,000 refugees fleeing the fighting in Ukraine as the humanitarian crisis from Russia’s attack on its neighbor worsens https://t.co/PpT64dYHgE.
Hawkins had been on tour in South America with the alternative rock band, which he joined in 1997 https://t.co/pybEpOoeM9
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/6fmcJBYSom https://t.co/WPg3LkCnQl

Elon Musk handed the first few Tesla Model Y vehicles to customers at the opening of Giga Berlin-Brandenburg, the electric-car company’s first European factory #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/vv5sl4yk59 https://t.co/c8XTVzGUrS
Women in Afghanistan must now be accompanied by a male relative to complete many basic tasks and say the Taliban are squeezing them out of public life https://t.co/MKPlcfKpjr
Russia said it was refocusing its mission in Ukraine on the country’s east, indicating a shift from its initial attempt to capture Kyiv https://t.co/3uOemnJiE2

Utah has become the 12th state to enact some sort of ban on transgender children in school sports after lawmakers voted to override Gov. Spencer Cox’s veto of legislation banning transgender youth athletes from playing on girls teams https://t.co/fcqd6Nyg4W

From @WSJopinion: It is vital to Europe’s peace and security that Ukraine not lose what remains of its Black Sea coastline, writes @ArthurLHerman. The U.S. and NATO can protect this strategic flank of Europe. https://t.co/Cde2rPHyec
The unlikeliest group of players ever to step onto the court at the Sweet 16 came out for warmups wearing T-shirts that declared the ethos that defines them: MORE IS POSSIBLE. https://t.co/QJrTJRgqwA

The House panel probing the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol has texts between Justice Clarence Thomas’s wife, conservative activist Virginia Thomas, and former President Donald Trump’s then-chief of staff, Mark Meadows, regarding the 2020 elections https://t.co/M6DNABsKPn
The U.S. is preparing sanctions targeting Russian companies it says are involved in buying goods and services for Moscow’s military and spy services https://t.co/dEvRinsYIk

Black News Channel, a cable news network that went on the air two years ago to provide an alternative look at news from Black Americans’ perspective, is shutting down, the outlet’s chief executive told employees on Friday https://t.co/SNXnRNonTC
Phoenix is America’s No. 1 metro area for inflation during the Biden administration. Voters there are not happy. https://t.co/75lxJEBq1R
Vanessa Bryant, widow of the late basketball star Kobe Bryant, and Nike have reached an agreement to collaborate on new shoes and start a youth basketball center https://t.co/JRS2wHnusf
When President Biden visits Poland, he will arrive in a country that has been thrust to the forefront of Western efforts to repel Russian aggression https://t.co/pDIvDFyb69

A 14-year-old boy died after falling off a 430-foot-tall ride called the Orlando FreeFall in Florida’s Icon Park Thursday night, officials said. “This death investigation is in its very early stages.” https://t.co/r7Khf8BOCL
Biden made a campaign vow that the U.S. should only use nuclear weapons to deter a nuclear threat. Under pressure from allies, he’s backing off that pledge. https://t.co/QIsOvjkQEu

Republican senators indicated that they don’t plan to take steps to significantly delay or block the confirmation of Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson, who wrapped up her testimony a day earlier and is on track for a vote early next month https://t.co/Xl926cblVy
Beijing is wary that its alignment with Russia during the Ukraine crisis could also cost its relationship with Europe https://t.co/eyNNJwEIF3
